sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"停留，逗留"之意。
means: remain ： 指某人或某物仍留在原处或保持原来的状态。
linger ： 着重因愉快的事而使人不愿离开。
stay ： 普通用词，多指人在某地暂时逗留。有时可指较长时间的居留。

word_mean: 马蹄嵴：狭窄的支持结构

phrase.cizu_name: be here (或 have come) to stay

lj.lj_ly: the private sector is here to stay and likely to expand.
lj.lj_ls: 那个私营部门已经得到普遍认可并有可能扩大规模。

jx.jx_en_mean: keep going strongly to the end of a race or contest
a delay in carrying out a court order
(S. African)used on departing as an expression of good wishes from the person leaving to the one staying
jx.jx_cn_mean: (南非)［分别时离开者对留下者的表达语］留得安好

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a sailing ship) be head to the wind while tacking
(of a sailing ship) fail in an attempt to go about from one tack to another
continue to study, work, or be somewhere after others have left
jx.jx_cn_mean: 继续学习（或工作）；继续留下

lj.lj_ly: 75 per cent of sixteen-year-olds stay on in full-time education.
lj.lj_ls: 75％的16岁孩子继续接受全日制教育。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a guest or visitor) sleep somewhere, especially at someone's home, for the night
jx.jx_cn_mean: （客人或造访者呆在别人家里）过夜

jx.jx_en_mean: To remain in a fixed or established position.

jx.jx_en_mean: To hold out or persevere to the end of a race or challenge.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 坚持到比赛或挑战的最后

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb): from Anglo-Norman French estai-, stem of Old French ester, from Latin stare 'to stand'; in the sense 'support' (senses 5 of the verb and 3 of the noun), partly from Old French estaye (noun), estayer (verb), of Germanic origin
Old English stag, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch stag, from a base meaning 'be firm'

entry.def: If you stay where you are, you continue to be there and do not leave.

example.ex: 'Stay here,' Trish said. 'I'll bring the car down the drive to take you back.'...
example.tran: “呆这别动，”特里西说,“我会把车开过来送你回去。”

example.ex: In the old days the woman stayed at home and the man earned the money.

entry.tran: (在某城市、旅馆或别人家)暂住，逗留
entry.def: If you stay in a town, or hotel, or at someone's house, you live there for a short time.

example.ex: Gordon stayed at The Park Hotel, Milan...
example.tran: 戈登下榻在米兰的帕克饭店。

example.ex: He tried to stay a few months every year in Scotland.
example.tran: 他每年都会争取在苏格兰住几个月。

entry.def: If someone or something stays in a particular state or situation, they continue to be in it.

example.ex: The Republican candidate said he would 'work like crazy to stay ahead'.
example.tran: 共和党候选人说他将“拼命保持领先优势”。

example.ex: ...community care networks that offer classes on how to stay healthy...
example.tran: 开设养生课程的社区保健网络

entry.def: If you stay away from a place, you do not go there.

example.ex: Government employees and officers also stayed away from work during the strike...
example.tran: 政府雇员和官员在罢工期间也没去上班。

example.ex: Every single employee turned up at the meeting, even people who usually stayed away.
example.tran: 所有雇员一个个不落都参加了会议，甚至平常不去开会的人都去了。

entry.def: If you stay out of something, you do not get involved in it.

example.ex: In the past, the UN has stayed out of the internal affairs of countries unless invited in...
example.tran: 在过去，除非有国家提出请求,否则联合国不会干涉各国内政。

example.ex: After months of staying well out of the problem, Washington has expressed a willingness to help find a solution.
example.tran: 几个月以来都不曾介入该问题的华盛顿方面已表示愿意帮助寻求解决方案。

entry.def: If you say that something is here to stay, you mean that people have accepted it and it has become a part of everyday life.

example.ex: Satellite TV is here to stay...
example.tran: 卫星电视已被普遍接受。

example.ex: Nuclear weapons are here to stay because they have changed the way countries approach the idea of war.
example.tran: 核武器已被广泛接受，因为它们改变了各国处理战争的方法。

entry.def: If you stay put, you remain somewhere.

example.ex: He was forced by his condition to stay put and remain out of politics...
example.tran: 他的健康状况迫使他留在原处,置身于政坛之外。

example.ex: Nigel says for the moment he is very happy to stay put in Lyon.
example.tran: 奈杰尔说目前他很乐意留在里昂。

entry.def: If you stay the night in a place, you sleep there for one night.

example.ex: They had invited me to come to supper and stay the night.
example.tran: 他们邀请我去吃晚饭并住上一晚。

means.word_mean: 1. continuing or remaining in a place or state;

sentences.sentence: "they had a nice stay in Paris"
"a lengthy hospital stay"
"a four-month stay in bankruptcy court"

means.word_mean: 2. a judicial order forbidding some action until an event occurs or the order is lifted;

sentences.sentence: "the Supreme Court has the power to stay an injunction pending an appeal to the whole Court"

means.word_mean: 3. the state of inactivity following an interruption;

sentences.sentence: "the negotiations were in arrest"
"held them in check"
"during the halt he got some lunch"
"the momentary stay enabled him to escape the blow"
"he spent the entire stop in his seat"

means.word_mean: 4. (nautical) brace consisting of a heavy rope or wire cable used as a support for a mast or spar
5. a thin strip of metal or bone that is used to stiffen a garment (e.g. a corset)
1. stay the same; remain in a certain state;

sentences.sentence: "The dress remained wet after repeated attempts to dry it"
"rest assured"
"stay alone"
"He remained unmoved by her tears"
"The bad weather continued for another week"
"We are staying in Detroit; we are not moving to Cincinnati"
"Stay put in the corner here!"
"Stick around and you will learn something!"
"You can stay with me while you are in town"
"stay a bit longer--the day is still young"

means.word_mean: 4. continue in a place, position, or situation;

sentences.sentence: "After graduation, she stayed on in Cambridge as a student adviser"
"Stay with me, please"
"despite student protests, he remained Dean for another year"
"She continued as deputy mayor for another year"
"I had to stay at home and watch the children"
"Please stay the bloodshed!"
"The smell stayed in the room"
"The hostility remained long after they made up"
"ride out the storm"
"The judge stayed the execution order"
"quell my hunger"

stems_affixes.word_buile: stab=stable稳定的,安定的+ility→n.稳定,安定
sta站,立+age场所,状态等→n.舞台，戏剧；阶段，时期

stems_affixes.value_cn: 逗留, 延缓, 中止, 支柱
stems_affixes.word_buile: sta站,立+y→n.逗留, 延缓, 中止, 支柱 v.在, 暂住
e=ex+stable牢固的+ish表动词→establish使其完全牢固→建立,设立,安置
sta站,立+y→n.逗留, 延缓, 中止, 支柱 v.在, 暂住

Sentence.sentence: When it came to light last year that mothers, far more than fathers,chose to stay home from work to care for their sick kids.
The woman will have to stay in hospital for a few days.
Singers use it to stay away from colds

sentences.en: I'm in a hurry; I've no time to stay.
sentences.cn: 我很忙, 没有时间待了。

sentences.en: He stayed the work and had the machinery removed.
sentences.cn: 他把工作停下来, 让人把机器搬掉。

sentences.en: Do you think this fine weather has come to stay?
sentences.cn: 你认为这种好天气能持久稳定下来吗?

sentences.en: She stayed to take care of her mother.
The weather stayed fine for a week.
sentences.cn: 这个星期天气一直很好。

jushi.english: You will have to run fast to stay abreast of our best runner and prevent him from winning.
jushi.chinese: 你得快跑,才能与我们那位最好的选手保持平行并阻止他拿第一。

jushi.english: Do you think this fine weather has come to stay?
jushi.chinese: 你认为这种好天气能持久稳定下来吗?

jushi.english: Our purpose was to make everyone realize that we were in the computer business to stay.
jushi.chinese: 我们的意图是使大家认识到我们是在计算机行业里长期做事。
